ZSI – Zentrum für Soziale Innovation (Center for Social Innovation), Vienna
ZSI (www.zsi.at), established 1990 as a private non-profit research organisation, is a pioneer and one of the international thought leaders in social innovation. Legally it is a limited liability company with common public interest status. Since its foundation ZSI aggregated multifaceted experiences in applied social scientific research using both quantitative and qualitative methods.
ZSI is Austria’s most successful social scientific research institute in EU Framework Programmes (since FP3). Main clients are: EC, ministries, municipalities, OECD, ILO, other public bodies and NGOs. Expertise includes the coordination and implementation of a wide variety of current projects in FP7, Horizon 2020, EU Structural Funds, European Territorial Cooperation, LLP, Erasmus+ and other projects funded nationally and internationally. Since many years, staff of more than 50 experts generates an average annual turnover of about EUR 3.5 mio. ZSI performs project-based agency functions for the Austrian Federal Ministry of Science, Research and Economy (BMWFW) in promotion and support of international STI cooperation.
ZSI’s key activities range from research, education and training, advisory services to public bodies and NGOs, on to networking projects. Thematically they are clustered in three dedicated units:
o Work and Equal Opportunities - incl. labour market governance; innovative labour market policies and inclusion; migration research; ageing)
o Research Policy and Development - incl. RTDI internationalisation; science-technology-society studies; scientometrics; evaluation)
o Technology and Knowledge - incl. participatory technology assessment; technology enhanced learning; science-society dialogue; citizen science)
